fdd:FDD.titleName: MPEG-4 File Format for Advanced Video Coding (Non-FRExt Extensions, Part 15)

fdd:identificationAndDescription.fdd:fullName: ISO/IEC 14496-15:2004. Information technology -- Coding of audio-visual objects -- Part 15: Advanced Video Coding (AVC) File Format (formal name); MPEG-4 AVC file format (common name)

fdd:description.p: The third MPEG-4 file format developed by the Moving Picture Experts Group (MPEG). The format's object-based design defines a set of tools that present binary coded representation of individual audiovisual objects, text, graphics, and synthetic objects. (See Notes below.) This format wraps Advanced Video Coding (AVC) with certain extensions, described in MPEG-4_AVC_EXT. Without those extensions, AVC may be wrapped in MP4_FF_2.

The extensions described here predate the FRExt (Fidelity Range Extensions), being finalized in 2005 and represented by four new profiles: MPEG-4_AVC_HP, MPEG-4_AVC_H10P, MPEG-4_AVC_H422P, and MPEG-4_AVC_H444P.

fdd:identificationAndDescription.fdd:shortDescription: Emerging format developed by the Moving Picture Experts Group (MPEG) for communicating audiovisual scenes, likely to be used for web content, other online applications, and mobile devices, i.e., cell phones and PDAs, although potential applications are much broader. Wraps Advanced Video Coding (AVC) with certain extensions, described in MPEG-4_AVC_EXT.

fdd:sustainabilityFactors.fdd:disclosure: Open standard. Developed by ISO technical program JTC 1/SC 29 (WG11), aka the Moving Picture Experts Group (MPEG), Coding of audio, picture, multimedia and hypermedia information.

fdd:sustainabilityFactors.fdd:adoption: Unknown to the compiler of this document
fdd:sustainabilityFactors.fdd:transparency: Depends upon included encodings, but all MPEG-4 encodings depend upon algorithms and tools to read and require sophistication to build tools.

fdd:internetMediaType.fdd:note: Most frequently cited MIME type; for more information see MP4_FF_2. The compiler of this document welcome comments on the use of MIME types for various MPEG-4 file formats.

fdd:other.fdd:tag: File type brand (ISO Base Media File Format)

fdd:values.fdd:note: ISO_BMFF includes a file type box that contains major and minor brands (identifiers); this brand is specified in Part 15, Section 5 (ISO/IEC 14496-15:2004. Information technology -- Coding of audio-visual objects -- Part 15: Advanced Video Coding (AVC) File Format, p. 13), only when certain AVC extensions are used.

fdd:general.p: The four file formats associated with the ISO/IEC 14496 family of specifications are:

ul.li: MP4_FF_1, "version 1" from the 2001 edition of Part 1
MP4_FF_AVCE, for Advanced Video Coding extensions, this document, from Part 15

fdd:general.p: For more extensive information about MPEG-4 file formats, see MP4_FF_2
